title: Independent School Primary (1st/2nd) Teacher
description:
Kalamazoo, MI Kalamazoo, MI Full-time Full-time From $40,000 a year From $40,000 a year 6 days ago 6 days ago 6 days ago Kazoo School is growing rapidly and is looking for exceptional educators to expand its Outdoor Educational programs for the 2023-2024 school year.
Kazoo School's mission is to prepare children to be confident critical thinkers, lifelong learners, and engaged citizens by providing a progressive educational environment that nurtures, empowers, and inspires.
As the school continues to grow during the 2023-2024 school year, Kazoo School looks to enrich its outdoor education program and is currently looking for a full-time Primary (1st/2nd) Teacher.
Kazoo School began with an organizational meeting in October of 1972, attended by a small group of parents and teachers led by Christine Morgan and Stephen Phillips.
The education of the whole child was the interest that bound those few parents and teachers at the beginning of the school's development as they sought to build... a challenging and nurturing program for their children.
That interest and celebration of childhood continue to be the most important aspect of our educational mission.
With a clear sense of purpose, The Kazoo School opened its doors in January 1973; there were eleven children and two teachers in that first class.
For over 45 years, our goal has been to educate students to become independent thinkers and lifelong learners.
We encourage students' academic excellence in an environment that values social responsibility and respect for others.
We believe that small class sizes, a warm and supportive environment, and a commitment to the arts are all essential elements of a well-educated person.
Kazoo School has grown and developed because of the cooperative spirit that began over 45 years ago when parents and teachers worked together to found this incredible institution.
That partnership continues today.
The tradition of parents and teachers working together in school life remains a fundamental cornerstone of all we do.
We recognize that the accomplishment of our educational mission depends on the partnership of all constituencies and our continuing commitment to building a community of learners.
Teacher Job Description For independent schools, the expectations of faculty are many, most notably the following:
Caring about kids, within and beyond the classroom.
Exhibiting enthusiasm for the topics one teaches.
Collaborating as a team player with teaching colleagues & administrators.
Seeing the school as a community.
Partnering with parents, communicating effectively, and frequently with them.
Marketing the school by a willingness to showcase one's teaching and to communicate with prospective families.
Supporting school activities by attending them.
Committing to ongoing professional development via an annual program of research, workshop attendance, visiting of others' classes and schools, writing, etc.
Learning new skills, such as integrating technology into the classroom, as changing pedagogy dictates.
Modeling self-disciplined and ethical behavior.
In short, independent school teachers are expected to teach by who they are and how they relate to others as much or more than by the lessons they prepare and deliver.
Knowledge of Subject Matter The Kazoo School teacher:
- has sufficient understanding of the material to give clear and accurate directions and answer questions - understands interrelationships of content areas, can integrate subject matter into other areas - directs students to appropriate resources - applies current ideas and issues in education - seeks further knowledge of the subject matter - models for students that adults do not always have all of the answers and how to seek new knowledge - integrates current events with curriculum - integrates themes of democracy, diversity, and sustainability - emphasizes physical and social-emotional learning alongside academics - understands and utilizes multiple methods of assessment that are non-competitive and encourage students to set goals and find joy in mastery Knowledge of Child Development and the Learning Process The Kazoo School teacher:
- uses understanding of child development and individual needs to set appropriate goals for each student - uses a variety of teaching styles in response to students' individual needs - develops plans based on individual and group needs and interests - assesses and monitors student progress in relation to specific objectives - communicates with parents about student progress and plans for continued growth - utilizes appropriate reinforcement strategies - drawing on student intrinsic motivation, helping students understand natural consequences - assess while teaching and makes appropriate modifications Presentation Skills The Kazoo School teacher:
- maintains clear objectives and goals, and shares these with students, as appropriate - utilizes a variety of teaching strategies - engages students as active participants in-class activities - plans activities/lessons that are relevant and meaningful to students and draw on students' prior knowledge and experiences - plans activities/lessons that are challenging but not frustrating for students Student Rapport The Kazoo School teacher:
- is an enthusiastic teacher and learner, a positive model for students - uses positive reinforcement methods - emphasis on positive behavior, 4 pillars, I Care language - elicits students' desire to learn - supports students' autonomy and problem-solving abilities - exhibits a sense of humor and fairness - demonstrates and fosters respectful relationships with each student - demonstrates caring and kindness with students - is responsive to students' interests, opinions, thoughts, and ideas - gives students a voice about things that matter to them Professionalism and Collegiality The Kazoo School teacher:
- maintains consistent communication with parents - both proactive and responsive - collaborates with teaching partner(s) and others - participates actively in committee work - is willing to discuss, try out, and reflect on new ideas and techniques - accepts criticism and works to improve - works actively to build and improve Kazoo School's program and reputation - not just getting by Job Type:
Full-time Pay:
From $40,000.
00 per year
Benefits:
Employee discount Grade levels:
1st grade 2nd grade Schedule:
Monday to Friday School type:
Private school Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred) Work Location:
In person In short, independent school teachers are expected to teach by who they are and how they relate to others as much or more than by the lessons they prepare and deliver.
.
Estimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications

title: Early Childhood Teacher - Young 3 year old room
description:
Job Description

PreK International is looking for a Lead Teacher for our 3-year-old room. The teacher's job is to encourage the children's healthy intellectual and psychological growth in our classroom. You will teach and supervise them while motivating them to use their mental capacities and exercise their imagination...

Responsibilities
• Design and follow a full schedule of activities and discover suitable teaching material
• Balance your teaching between logical and social exercises
• Provide primary care and caregiving activities
• Use various teaching methods (stories, media, indoor or outdoor games, drawing, etc.) to enhance the child’s abilities.
• Evaluate children’s performance to make sure they are on the right learning track
• Remain in constant communication with parents and update them on the progress of their children
• Observe children’s interactions and promote the spirit of concord
• Identify behavioral problems and determine the right course of action
• Collaborate with other colleagues
• Adhere to teaching standards and safety regulations as established by the official sources

Requirements
• BA in Early Childhood or higher
• Proven experience as a Child Care / Daycare Teacher
• Excellent knowledge of child development and up-to-date education methods
• Methodical and creative
• Patience, flexibility, and love for children
• Strong communication and time management skills
• Certificate in first aid and CPR

Number of hires for this role: 4

Benefits: Bonus based on performance + paid time off

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $41,600.00 per year

Benefits:
• Paid time off
• Professional development assistance
• Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday ( 7:15 am to 3 pm)

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Kalamazoo, MI 49048: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Professional development assistance
• Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday
• No nights
• No weekends

Work Location: In person

title: Full Time Special Education Teacher 23/24 in Kalamazoo, Michigan
description:
Minimum 1+ years special education experience required.

Soliant Health is seeking a Special Education Teacher who is interested in working in a school setting in Kalamazoo, MI. In this role, the SPED will be providing services for school age students ranging from grades K-12. Please see job details below...

Job Description & Requirements:
• 2023 - 2024 School Year
• Previous school experience preferred, but not required
• Must have active or pending state Teaching license
• Guaranteed hours for direct and indirect services
• Industry leading benefits in Health, Dental, Vision, and Matching 401(k)

If you are interested apply as soon as possible to be considered.Feel free to contact me with any questions regarding this position, or any other positions you see on the Soliant Health website.

Kyle Meese
Account Executive| Soliant Health

Kyle.Meese@soliant

title: Middle School teacher for Alternative Education School
description:
Kalamazoo, MI Kalamazoo, MI Full-time Full-time $40,302 - $48,536 a year $40,302 - $48,536 a year 3 days ago 3 days ago 3 days ago This position is responsible for providing quality instruction to students in a small, regular classroom setting.
Grades 7-8 are in this room.
Job Duties...
Develop effective teaching strategies to promote student growth while meeting the school's specific objectives.
Implement effective assessment methods to ensure student growth and successfully prepare students for their next grade.
Develop professional relationships with students, parents and staff.
Complete required professional development activities, and make sure employees are up to date on curriculum.
Ensure classroom is clean and organized at all times.
Participate in staff meetings and keep detailed records of class observations and student progress.
Other duties as assigned.
Skills &
Qualifications:
A valid Kalamazoo, MI driver's license with a good driving record.
College Degree Current MI Certification in grades 7-8 Previous experience teaching children preferred.
Ability to work well in a team environment.
Ability to communicate effectively with parents and students.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Full-time Pay:

25 - $48,536.
04 per year
